title: How do people sell copyrighted books on eBay? - Quora

response.answer_text: Under the First Sale doctrine, if a form of physical media was acquired in a way that was licensed and permitted by the copyright holder, then that physical media can be resold in its entirety without being an infringement of copyright. Not every country has this. In France a fee must be collected for every book sale, even person-to-person. Those fees go to a government fund that pays authors when their works are resold. By the First Sale doctrine exists in the U.S. where eBay is located.

Copyright means the control of the right to control the making of copies. If you’re selling a copy of a printed book that you bought legally, then you have the right to re-sell that copy, and you are not infringing copyright. If you have an ebook, then the move of that ebook from you to the buyer would involve the creation of a new copy. THAT would infringe copyright. This might not be so, if there were a way to ensure that your own copy were destroyed. There is no such way.
